```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r}
us_data = read_csv("../data/us_2017.csv") %>% 
  filter(state != "District of Columbia")
```

```{r}
# gun
us_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = number_of_guns_per_capita, y = suicide_rate_per100000)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Number of guns per 1000 population", 
       y = "Suicide rate per 100000 population")

# alcohol
us_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = alcohol_consumption_per_capita_gallons, y = suicide_rate_per100000)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Alcohol consumption per capita (gallons of ethanol)"ï¼Œ 
       y = "Suicide rate per 100000 population")

# temperature
us_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = mean_temperature_F, y = suicide_rate_per100000)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Average temperature (F)", 
       y = "Suicide rate per 100000 population")

# precipitation
us_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = precipitation_inches, y = suicide_rate_per100000)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Average precipitation (inches)",
       y = "Suicide rate per 100000 population")

# marijuana
us_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = marijuana_percentage * 100, y = suicide_rate_per100000)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Marijuana use in adults (%)", 
       y = "Suicide rate per 100000 population")

# education
us_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = (advanced_degree + bachelors_degree) * 100, y = suicide_rate_per100000)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Educational attainment - bachelor's degree or higher (%) ",
       y = "Suicide rate per 100000 population")

# gdp
us_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = gdp, y = suicide_rate_per100000)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "GDP per capita (dollars)",
       y = "Suicide rate per 100000 population")

# gender
us_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = male_ratio * 100, y = suicide_rate_per100000)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Male (%)",
       y = "Suicide rate per 100000 population")

# age
us_data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = male_ratio * 100, y = suicide_rate_per100000)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Male (%)",
       y = "Suicide rate per 100000 population")

# no data about average age 
```
